text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to identify that Article V(1)(e) of the New York Convention allows refusal of enforcement when an award has been set aside at the seat of arbitration (Paris). The candidate answer explicitly addresses this in Section IV, stating: \"A subsidiary argument may arise under **Article V(1)(e)** — that the award has been 'set aside' or is not yet binding — though this is unlikely unless proceedings are initiated at the seat (Paris).\" It then discusses the implications if the opponent seeks annulment in France. This directly satisfies the requirement of the criterion.", "criterion_id": "4e27ec7e-c6c3-4702-94e3-c62fdc7b481d"}
